newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan Formosa plans aromatics plant -paper.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan Formosa plans aromatics plant -paper.

text.p: Formosa Chemicals and Fiber Corp will invest T$20 billion to build an aromatics plant in central Taiwan as part of parent Formosa Plastics Group's huge petrochemical project, local media said on Wednesday.
Taiwan's Commercial Times reported that the aromatics plant would have annual capacity of 1.02 million tonnes and would be completed by late 1999.
Formosa officials were unavailable for immediate comment.
Formosa group, empowered by liberalisation to challenge oil monopoly Chinese Petroleum Corp, began building Taiwan's first private naphtha cracker in 1993.
The cracker is the core of a massive US$9 billion cracker and oil refinery complex due for completion by 1999.

The newspaper report was the first disclosure that Formosa planned to include an aromatics plant in the complex and it was not clear whether the plant's T$20 billion budget was part of a T$23 billion earmarked for related chemical plants.
